newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's Hanson up, govt down in latest poll.
newsitem.headline: Australia's Hanson up, govt down in latest poll.

text.p: Australian right-winger Pauline Hanson has continued to grab voter support from Prime Minister John Howard's conservative coalition, a newspaper poll showed on Tuesday.

Howard's Liberal-National coalition's support fell one percentage point to 40 percent -- 15 points below its peak after winning power in March 1996 and now just one point clear of the Labor opposition, The Australian's Newspoll found.
Hanson's newly-formed One Nation Party gained two points to nine percent since the last poll a week ago.
